articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Fighting in the city of Rafah, where Israel is targeting the remaining brigades of the militant Islamist Hamas movement, would continue, the military said.
articles.title: Israeli military announces tactical pauses in Gaza for aid supplies

articles.author: Thomas Escritt, Sabine Siebold
articles.description: Western powers and countries from the rest of the world will use the second day of a major summit in Switzerland on Sunday to pursue a consensus on condemning Russia's invasion of Ukraine and underscoring concerns about the war's human cost.
articles.title: Ukraine summit strives for broad consensus to lean on Russia to end war

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Six detainees, some with links to Islamic State, took guards hostage at a pre-trial detention centre in Russia's southern region of Rostov and demanded free passage in negotiations with the authorities, Russian media reported on Sunday.
articles.title: Prisoners with ISIS links take guards hostage in Russian detention centre, media report

articles.author: Sophie Yu, Casey Hall, Lisa Barrington
articles.description: A recovery in Chinese overseas travel from the COVID-19 pandemic is fading as rising costs and difficulties in securing visas cement a preference for local and short-haul destinations.
articles.title: Chinese outbound travel recovery lags due to costs, visa snags

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Intensified cross-border fire from Lebanon's Hezbollah movement into Israel could trigger serious escalation, the Israeli military said on Sunday.
articles.title: Israel warns of escalation from cross-border fire from Hezbollah

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Thailand faces a critical week of court cases that could trigger a political crisis in Southeast Asia's second-largest economy, with the fate of the prime minister and the main opposition hanging in the balance.
articles.title: Explainer: Four Thai court cases that could unleash political crisis

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: German police fired shots at a person who threatened officers with a pickaxe and an incendiary device on the sidelines of a soccer fan parade in the St Pauli district of central Hamburg on Sunday, according to a police post on social media platform X.
articles.title: German police fire shots at axe-wielding person at Hamburg soccer fan parade

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A landslide in Ecuador killed at least six people and left 30 others missing, according to preliminary information from Ecuadorian authorities on Sunday.
articles.title: Landslide in Ecuador kills at least 6, leaves 30 missing

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A wildfire burning northwest of Los Angeles on Sunday has forced the evacuation of over 1,000 people from a popular outdoor recreation area and burned over 12,000 acres, authorities said.
articles.title: California wildfire burns 12,000 acres, forces evacuations

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: South Africa's uMkhonto we Sizwe (MK) party will join an alliance of smaller opposition parties in parliament in a bid to take on the African National Congress and Democratic Alliance-led coalition government, it said on Sunday.
articles.title: Ex-leader Zuma's party says it will join opposition in South Africa's parliament
